articles.headline: Restoring Names to War’s Unknown Casualties
articles.snippet: A quest to confirm the death of a loved one — a son, husband, father and brother — took years, along with courage and luck.
articles.abstract: A quest to confirm the death of a loved one — a son, husband, father and brother — took years, along with courage and luck.
articles.lead_paragraph: BAGHDAD  In a pastel-colored room at the Baghdad morgue known simply as the Missing, where faces of the thousands of unidentified dead of this war are projected onto four screens, Hamid Jassem came on a Sunday searching for answers.

articles.headline: Doctors Seek Way to Treat Muscle Loss
articles.snippet: Why muscles wither is captivating more scientists and drug and food companies, let alone aging baby boomers.
articles.abstract: Why muscles wither is captivating more scientists and drug and food companies, let alone aging baby boomers.
articles.lead_paragraph: Bears emerge from months of hibernation with their muscles largely intact. Not so for people, who, if bedridden that long, would lose so much muscle they would have trouble standing.

articles.headline: Egg Farms Violated Safety Rules
articles.snippet: Inspections, the F.D.A. said, found barns infested with flies, maggots and rodents, as well as overflowing manure pits.
articles.abstract: Inspections, the F.D.A. said, found barns infested with flies, maggots and rodents, as well as overflowing manure pits.
articles.lead_paragraph: Barns infested with flies, maggots and scurrying rodents, and overflowing manure pits were among the widespread food safety problems that federal inspectors found at a group of Iowa egg farms at the heart of a nationwide recall and salmonella outbreak.

articles.headline: Making Soldiers Fit to Fight, Without the Situps
articles.snippet: The goal of a new training program is to reduce injuries and better prepare recruits for the rigors of combat.
articles.abstract: The goal of a new training program is to reduce injuries and better prepare recruits for the rigors of combat.
articles.lead_paragraph: FORT JACKSON, S.C.  Dawn breaks at this, the Army’s largest training post, with the reliable sound of fresh recruits marching to their morning exercise. But these days, something looks different.

articles.headline: Outlines Emerge of Future State in the West Bank
articles.snippet: Some see encouraging signs about a two-state solution in improved security and governance by Palestinians.
articles.abstract: Some see encouraging signs about a two-state solution in improved security and governance by Palestinians.
articles.lead_paragraph: RAMALLAH, West Bank  As preparations intensify for a Palestinian-Israeli summit meeting in Washington on Thursday, the crude outlines of a Palestinian state are emerging in the West Bank, with increasingly reliable security forces, a more disciplined government and a growing sense among ordinary citizens that they can count on basic services.

articles.headline: New Stickers Will Go Beyond M.P.G. in Rating Cars
articles.snippet: The Obama administration is planning the biggest change in three decades to the window stickers in new cars.
articles.abstract: The Obama administration is planning the biggest change in three decades to the window stickers in new cars.
articles.lead_paragraph: The Obama administration proposed on Monday two alternatives to the window stickers in new vehicles, including one that would assign letter grades for fuel economy and greenhouse gas emissions.

articles.headline: Banks Grow Wary of Environmental Risks
articles.snippet: Some lenders are taking a stand on practices like mining and deforestation that may be risky to their reputations.
articles.abstract: Some lenders are taking a stand on practices like mining and deforestation that may be risky to their reputations.
articles.lead_paragraph: Blasting off mountaintops to reach coal in Appalachia or churning out millions of tons of carbon dioxide to extract oil from sand in Alberta are among environmentalists’ biggest industrial irritants. But they are also legal and lucrative.

articles.headline: Why Wall St. Is Deserting Obama
articles.snippet: Supporters in the financial industry say they expected more regulation and higher taxes, but they did not realize that they would be painted as villains.
articles.abstract: Supporters in the financial industry say they expected more regulation and higher taxes, but they did not realize that they would be painted as villains.
articles.lead_paragraph: Daniel S. Loeb, the hedge fund manager, was one of Barack Obama’s biggest backers in the 2008 presidential campaign.

articles.headline: Obama Declares an End to Combat Mission in Iraq
articles.snippet: In an address from the Oval Office, President Obama said that the nation had met its responsibility to Iraq and would now turn to domestic concerns.
articles.abstract: In an address from the Oval Office, President Obama said that the nation had met its responsibility to Iraq and would now turn to domestic concerns.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President Obama declared an end on Tuesday to the seven-year American combat mission in Iraq, saying that the United States has met its responsibility to that country and that it is now time to turn to pressing problems at home.
articles.byline: By Helene Cooper and Sheryl Gay Stolberg
